codepilot

a project-wide synchronous editor: eliminate merge conflicts. for programmers unfamiliar with the nuance of using version control while working collaboratively.

features

  • synchronous, project-wide realtime editing on any git repo
  • github API integration: edit, test, diff, branch, and commit
  • import, create, document, and close github issues

synchronous editing

interactive testing

github integration

background - thesis

This work was presented at CHI 2016.

This was the project I worked on for my MS thesis from the University of Rochester, and was the first version of the site now hosted at git-sync.com. CodePilot is a tool meant to help people collaborate on code more seamlessly. The model is based on that of a pilot and a co-pilot, where the pilot does most of the actual programming, and the co-pilot performs background coding tasks. This could include version control management, system testing, online reference lookup, and commenting or documenting source code. This project is open source, and the source code can be found on GitHub.
